intro: Centropogon cuspidatus, commonly known as the sharp-ended ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its tuberous roots and hairy, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange with a distinctive hooded structure. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
